Problem:
Consider a complex function defined as \\( z(t) = e^{iAt} w \\), where A is a real constant and w is a constant complex vector. We are interested in evaluating the impact of the integral transformation \\( I(z) = \\int_{0}^{t} e^{iB\\tau} z(\\tau) d\\tau \\), where B is another real constant.

If the initial function \\( z(t) \\) evolves naturally without any transformation, will its state at time T be different after application of \\( I(z) \\) without intervention?
Explanation: The function \\( z(t) \\) evolves as \\( e^{iAt} w \\) irrespective of the transformation until an explicit application of \\( I(z) \\). The natural evolution path remains unchanged by the definition of \\( I(z) \\) until it’s applied.
